text.p: Italian apparel and footware company Fila Holdings SpA fell in heavy trade Monday, weighed down by by its forecast that second-quarter earnings would be below analysts' expectations.
Fila fell 4-1/2 to 32-7/8 in volume that by early afternoon was almost six times normal daily levels. The company was among the most active among American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) in New York.

After the markets closed Friday Fila said in a statement it expected its earnings per share for the second quarter to be between $0.53 and $0.60. A First Call consensus estimate by analysts was for $0.88 a share.
Fila said its earnings would be hurt by general weakness in the U.S. footwear and apparel market, which led to an increase in canceled orders.
Among other active ADRs, Singaporean software company Creative Technology Ltd rose 7/8 to 16-3/8 and Canada's Philip Environmental Inc was unchanged at 14-5/8.
Brazilian telephone company Telebras SA eased 1/8 to 139-5/8.
ADRs allow U.S. trade of foreign shares.
